intro: Sebaea vitellina, commonly known as the yellow bell or yellow star, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and thrives in partial to full sun. Its leaves are simple, ovate, and have a velvety texture, while its stems are often hairy. Sebaea vitellina is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
